intro: Neurocarpum longifolium, commonly known as the longleaf neurocarpum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that can reach up to 30 centimeters in length. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in temperate regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and herbal practices.
